works.description: These projects are the result of teamwork, interdisciplinary collaboration, well-defined processes and validation. My contributions were always centered around UX.

projects.title: Activity tracking mobile app
projects.description: We were three people collaborating on this project. I was the main point of contact with the client, working closely with them defining the goals for the project, managing any unexpected changes that happened along the way and acting as a liaison with the rest of my team. I was in charge of the UX Design, defining the overall structure and behavior of the award-winning Level app. I also conducted remote moderated Usability Testing sessions to test our assumptions. Another designer handled the UI Design, and another the Animations.

projects.title: Graphic system for screen and print
projects.description: I worked with this client for several years, on many projects ranging from websites, to mobile apps and printed materials. The main challenge was keeping all their sub-brands coherent yet unique. My contributions varied according to the needs of the project. On different occasions I served as the Project Manager, I was in charge of UX Design, conducted moderated Usability Testing sessions, participated in the UI Design phase, and did QA.

projects.title: Travel mobile app for iOS
projects.description: Three people team. I worked on the UX design phase alongside the Creative Director, defining the IA and IxD, while a teammate defined the visual styles (UI Design).

projects.title: News curation web app
projects.description: We were two designers working on the project. My main collaboration was leading the UX Design for the main feature of the Boost.ly app called the Ripple Gauge.

works.description: I selected these projects because I worked on them on my own and had 100% creative freedom to define all visual styles, as well as the overall structure and behavior.

projects.title: Visual identity and website design
projects.description: At Haiku, I was tasked with redesigning the company’s marketing website for the re-brand of Animator, Haiku’s first product. In this opportunity, I was given total freedom to define the new visual identity for the company, including typography, color palette and overall visual style. I decided to use an ample palette that would give us leverage once the company started launching more products. For the Animator landing page (pictured here) I chose to use keyframes as custom product miscellanea, envisioning a similar yet unique treatment for all future products.

projects.title: Personal blog
projects.description: Before taking my blog posts to Medium, I designed my very own personal blog, including highlighted articles, filterable “book recommendations” and “useful tools” sections, and a tag-based archive for older posts. For this personal project I selected a condensed typography with a lot of personality, and a simple analogous color palette in warm tones. I also allotted an important amount of real estate to vivid and colorful imagery to accompany each blog post.

projects.title: Metronome app
projects.description: For this passion project, the concept was to help people learn how to follow rhythms with a layer of gamification. I handled the UX/UI Design and a colleague the code.

projects.title: Demo app for Diez
projects.description: I was asked to design a sample app that was simple yet had a lot of visual contrast, to show how Diez helps update your Design Language instantly and across codebases.

works.description: In my spare time I like to paint on canvas, draw, and make digital illustrations. Realism is my style of choice, but I also enjoy dabbing in other techniques.

projects.title: Headshot illustration
projects.description: I created this realistic digital illustration from a reference image of a model on iPad Pro + pencil on Procreate.

projects.title: Detailed feature practice
projects.description: This is a realistic illustration from a reference image created on Adobe Sketch for iPad Pro.

projects.title: A trip to the moon
projects.description: Anaglyph 3D illustration based on the original poster for the film A Trip to the Moon (1902) by Georges Méliès, also featured in the film Hugo.

projects.title: Hello Dribbble!
projects.description: When I received an invitation to join Dribbble I created this digital vector illustration to kickstart my participation in the community.

works.description: During my time at Haiku I learned to add interactivity and animation to my illustrations, to create engaging pieces that communicate ideas and delight users.

projects.title: Brandbook hero
projects.description: I was tasked to create a series of animated illustrations, one for each of the company products: Animator, Diez, Brandbook and Storybook for Teams. All of these are currently displayed on Haiku’s homepage and on each product landing page/website. Each animation was tailored to communicate what the product is for and how it works, in a nutshell. In this one, you can see there’s a dashboard containing your design tokens, which can be modified and those changes would automatically propagate across codebases.

projects.title: Learn page hero
projects.description: Animator has a section dedicated to learning resources and tutorials, the Learn page. I was tasked to create an animated Hero section that would somehow communicate the purpose of this page. I decided to illustrate a set of hands and have them draw different types of lines, each one animated using a variety of techniques and features available in the app, like Opacity, Scale and Stroke Dasharray and Dashoffset.

projects.title: Email marketing coupon
projects.description: I created this animation to accompany an email marketing campaign offering two months free for Animator, to celebrate the product’s re-brand.

projects.title: Animator error state
projects.description: I built a series of interactive animations to illustrate different user flows. This one is shown when the user hits an error state and is given instructions to safely continue.

recommendations.content: I worked closely with Agustina for about two months on a major product redesign. She is a jack of all trades - insightful researcher, creative designer, efficient project manager, savvy technologist, and overall consummate professional. Before this project I thought I had to be co-located with a design firm to get a quality product. Agustina proved me very wrong! Her skill, flexibility, and professionalism made it a breeze.
recommendations.name: Xander Mitman

recommendations.content: I had the pleasure of being Agustina's client partner while designing an app for a new category of products - activity tracking smart glasses. She was a great resource for helping the team find a direction that was both user-friendly and functional. She was always willing to go out of her way to meet the team's expectations, while pushing back when necessary,and was very agile when unexpected directional changes occurred. Her testing methods were thorough and gave us confidence that we were shipping a product that people would love. Anyone would be lucky to have Agustina on their team.
recommendations.name: Kristi Gaudio

recommendations.content: Agustina is an absolute joy to work with. Dedicated, passionate, a very creative problem-solver and excellent communicator. I very much enjoyed working with her, and she delivered a final product that was far beyond my wildest and most unreasonable expectations. I would not hesitate to hire or work with her in any capacity, and hope I have the opportunity again myself someday.
recommendations.name: James Wirth

recommendations.content: Agustina was fresh out of college when she joined our agency, and although she had a strong background graphic design, she was fairly new to designing digital products and it’s been truly a pleasure to see her grow as a designer and become fluent with the UX design process these past few years. She’s a very dedicated and hard-working person with a great ability to solve complex problems. She’s also very easy and fun to work with, which makes it an asset for any team. I would definitely work with her again!
recommendations.name: Mariano Andrés García
